intro: Barleria subglobosa, commonly known as the globe barleria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30 to 60 centimeters. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves that are often hairy and have a slightly rough texture. Its showy, clustered flowers are usually pink or red, with five petals and a distinctive tubular throat. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas.
